intro: Alstonia undulata, commonly known as the wavy alstonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that have a wavy or undulating margin, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits. Alstonia undulata is often cultivated for its attractive foliage and can thrive in warm, humid environments with partial shade.
